titleStmt.title: To WILLIAM JOHN BELLEW ARCHERSir John Bowring (1792-1872; Dictionary of National Biography), politician, diplomat and writer. First editor of the Westminster Review. Elected MP for Bolton in June 1841 as a free-trade candidate; held his seat for over seven years. 2 SEPTEMBER 1841

body.p: Mr Charles Dickens presents his compliments to Mr Archer, and perfectly well remembers (now that it is recalled to his recollection) the paper Unidentified . . . and which he no longer has an opportunity of publishing.n Bentley's Miscellany, which CD edited Jan 1837-Feb 1839. It may be pleasant to Mr Archer to know that it returns quite fresh to Mr Dickens' memory, although at the time when the note Unidentified was written he had some three or four score Mss every month
